means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 汤 Tong的变体

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"语言"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: laguage, speech, tongue, dialect, idiom, slang
means: laguage ： 普通用词，含义广。指人的语言或文字，或动物的语言。既可指口头或书面语言，也可指手势语等。
speech ： 特指人的口语，也指正式的讲话。
tongue ： 书面用词，指人的语言，亦指人的母语。
dialect ： 指一种语言中，某一地方所特有的语言形式，即方言。
idiom ： 指一种语言中一般由几个词结合成短语或句子的特殊表达方式，即惯用语、成语。也指方言。

word_mean: 舌：口腔底部可动肌性器官，司味觉，协助咀嚼、吞咽和发音。同lingua 〔NA〕
舌形物：任何与舌形相似的组织结构或局部
舌，嘴里辨别滋味、帮助咀嚼和发音的器官。

sentence.Network_en: Teddy clucked his tongue like a disapproving English matron.
sentence.Network_cn: 特迪咂了咂舌头，活像个不以为然的英国女舍监。

sentence.Network_en: He stuck out his tongue and flared his nostrils.
sentence.Network_cn: 他伸出舌头，鼻翼扇动着。

sentence.Network_en: I walked over to the mirror and stuck my tongue out.
sentence.Network_cn: 我走到镜子前面伸出舌头。

jx.jx_en_mean: be able (or unable) to express oneself after a shock
jx.jx_cn_mean: 受惊后能（或不 能）说话了

lj.lj_ly: she found it very difficult to get her tongue round the unfamiliar words.
lj.lj_ls: 她发现很难念出这些陌生的单词来。

jx.jx_en_mean: the power of speaking in unknown languages, regarded as one of the gifts of the Holy Spirit (Acts 2)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 圣灵所赐的特异的语言能力；口才

jx.jx_en_mean: (of hounds) bark, especially on finding a scent

phrase.cizu_name: keep a civil tongue in one's head

jx.jx_en_mean: without really meaning what one is saying or writing
someone is very eager for something, especially a drink

lj.lj_ly: the tabloids have their tongues hanging out for this stuff.

jx.jx_en_mean: To lose the capacity to speak, as from shock.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 失声：失去说话的能力，例如由于震惊

jx.jx_en_mean: On the verge of being recalled or expressed.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 差点说出某事：在被回忆出或表达出来的边缘

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tunge, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch tong, German Zunge, and Latin lingua

entry.def: Your tongue is the soft movable part inside your mouth which you use for tasting, eating, and speaking.

example.ex: I walked over to the mirror and stuck my tongue out...
example.tran: 我走到镜子前面伸出舌头。

example.ex: She ran her tongue around her lips.

entry.def: You can use tongue to refer to the kind of things that a person says.

example.tran: 她敏捷的才思和伶俐的口齿

example.ex: She had a nasty tongue, but I liked her.
example.tran: 她言辞尖刻，但我喜欢她。

example.ex: The French feel passionately about their native tongue.
example.tran: 法国人对他们的母语非常热爱。

entry.tran: (烹制后通常作为冷盘的)牛舌，羊舌
entry.def: Tongue is the cooked tongue of an ox or sheep. It is usually eaten cold.
The tongue of a shoe or boot is the piece of leather which is underneath the laces.

entry.tran: 舌状物;火舌;伸入水中的狭长陆地
entry.def: A tongue of something such as fire or land is a long thin piece of it.

example.ex: A yellow tongue of flame shot upwards.
example.tran: 一条黄色的火舌直冲上天。
一条冻结了的银色水舌

entry.def: A tongue-in-cheek remark or attitude is not serious, although it may seem to be.

example.tran: 漫不经心、虚情假意的态度

example.ex: This is all slightly tongue-in-cheek, I'd like to make that clear…
example.tran: 这一切都有些缺少诚意，我想清楚地指出这点。

entry.def: If you hold your tongue, you do not say anything even though you might want to or be expected to, because it is the wrong time to say it.

example.ex: Douglas held his tongue, preferring not to speak out on a politically sensitive issue.
example.tran: 道格拉斯沉默不语，不愿谈论政治敏感问题。

entry.tran: 正确发出(难读单词或短语)的音
entry.def: If you say that you can not get your tongue round or around a particular word or phrase, you mean that you find it very difficult to pronounce.
If you describe something you said as a slip of the tongue, you mean that you said it by mistake.

example.ex: At one stage he referred to Anna as John's fiancée, but later said that was a slip of the tongue.
example.tran: 曾有那么一段时间他把安娜称作约翰的未婚妻，但后来又说那是口误。

means.word_mean: 1. a mobile mass of muscular tissue covered with mucous membrane and located in the oral cavity
2. a human written or spoken language used by a community; opposed to e.g. a computer language
3. any long thin projection that is transient;

sentences.sentence: "tongues of flame licked at the walls"
"rifles exploded quick knives of fire into the dark"

means.word_mean: 5. a narrow strip of land that juts out into the sea
6. the tongue of certain animals used as meat
7. the flap of material under the laces of a shoe or boot
8. metal striker that hangs inside a bell and makes a sound by hitting the side
1. articulate by tonguing, as when playing wind instruments
2. lick or explore with the tongue

list.explanation: 收回你讲的话。(意指你应该感到羞愧。)

example.en: How could you do such a nasty thing and still call yourself my friend? Bite your tongue!
example.zh: 干出这样卑鄙的事你竟然还能自称是我的朋友？你应该感到羞愧!

auth_sentence.res_content: Unwin defends her blog, claiming it was tongue-in-cheek.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Unwin defends her blog, claiming it was tongue-in-cheek.

auth_sentence.res_content: Clicking his tongue on the roof of his mouth.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Clicking his tongue on the roof of his mouth.

auth_sentence.content: I have a sharp tongue and a thorny exterior.
auth_sentence.res_content: I have a sharp tongue and a thorny exterior.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I have a sharp tongue and a thorny exterior.

Sentence.sentence: No, I think they are just asking all the firms in tongue for as much money as they think they'll give.

jushi.english: Her name was on the tip of my tongue, but for the life of me I couldn't recall it.
jushi.chinese: 她的名字就在我的嘴边上,可是我无论如何也想不起来了。

jushi.english: Do not give occasion to scandalous tongues to speak of you.
jushi.chinese: 你不要给那些喜欢恶意中伤的人说你坏话的机会。
